text:
I tried print some svg documents using batik 1.6 but the print size was smaller
than expected.

Example svg document:

<?xml version="1.0" standalone="no"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 1.1//EN"
  "http://www.w3.org/Graphics/SVG/1.1/DTD/svg11.dtd">
<svg id="mapLayout"
  width="8.5in"
  height="11.0in"
  viewBox="0 0 612.0 792.0"
  preserveAspectRatio="xMidYMid meet"
  xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" version="1.1">
  <rect x="0.5" y="0.5" width="611.5" height="791.5"
   stroke="#000000" stroke-width="1" fill="#f0fff0" />
</svg>

Expected print size: 8.5 x 11 inches
Actual print size: 6.375 x 8.25 inches (roughly)
Printer: Adobe PDF Converter (Acrobat Pro 6)

Thanks.
creator: yzstone@hotmail.com

text:
There were some fixes to the PrintTranscoder since the 1.6 release.
You might try getting the current SVN version and see if that fixes your
problem.
creator: deweese@apache.org
yzstone@hotmail.com

creator: yzstone@hotmail.com
text:
I added the xalan jar to the build path of eclipse and this solved the class
import problem.  Yes the print but is fixed in this build.  Thanks for your
great work!

By the way, is there a planned major or minor release in recent months?
